[{"wordEn":"trivet","wordAn":"tuŋkóʔ","langSubgroup":"WMP","langName":"Tagalog","wordEnLong":"tripod, three stones in an open fireplace roughly forming a kind of tripod to hold pots or other cooking containers","setnote":"Given its meaning one would not expect this to be a loan distribution.  However, three independent pieces of evidence show that the words in Tagalog, Ngaju Dayak, Malagasy and Javanese are almost certainly Malay loans.  First, Tagalog shows -Ɂ corresponding to Malay final vowel.  Second, the word is unknown in any language of the Philippines apart from Tagalog.
